Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 29 points, leading the Celtics to a 113-103 victory over the Hornets.
Payton Pritchard contributed 22 points with six 3-pointers.
LaMelo Ball scored 36 points for the Hornets before fouling out for the second straight game.
Derrick White added 18 points and eight rebounds for the Celtics.
Jrue Holiday hit a crucial 3-pointer to end a Hornets rally in the third quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics managed to win despite the absence of Jaylen Brown, who sat out with a hip flexor strain.
LaMelo Ball needs to avoid foul trouble as he is too valuable to the Hornets to be sitting on the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics outrebounded the Hornets 44-34, with Charlotte missing their top two centers, Mark Williams and Nick Richards.
